compliance_objective: Ensure the applicant is a corporation as defined by law.
explanation: The applicant must be a corporation that meets the definition set forth in the Companies Ordinance.
heading: to, the Drug Trafficking (Recovery of Proceeds) Ordinance (Cap. 405);

compliance_objective: Confirm the applicant is a fit and proper person.
explanation: The Commission must be satisfied that the applicant is a fit and proper person to be licensed for the VA service.
heading: to, the Drug Trafficking (Recovery of Proceeds) Ordinance (Cap. 405);

compliance_objective: Ensure responsible officers are fit and proper.
explanation: At least two responsible officers must be fit and proper persons associated with the VA service.
heading: to, the Drug Trafficking (Recovery of Proceeds) Ordinance (Cap. 405);

compliance_objective: Confirm directors are fit and proper.
explanation: Each director of the applicant must be a fit and proper person to be associated with the VA service.
heading: to, the Drug Trafficking (Recovery of Proceeds) Ordinance (Cap. 405);

compliance_objective: Verify the ultimate owner is fit and proper.
explanation: If there is an ultimate owner, they must also be a fit and proper person associated with the VA service.
heading: to, the Drug Trafficking (Recovery of Proceeds) Ordinance (Cap. 405);

compliance_objective: Implement anti-money laundering and anti-terrorist financing policies.
explanation: Conditions may be imposed on the licence regarding the establishment of AML and CTF policies and procedures.
heading: to, the Drug Trafficking (Recovery of Proceeds) Ordinance (Cap. 405);

compliance_objective: Ensure supervision of the VA service.
explanation: There must be at least one responsible officer available at all times to supervise the VA service.
heading: to, the Drug Trafficking (Recovery of Proceeds) Ordinance (Cap. 405);

compliance_objective: Prohibit use of unlicensed names.
explanation: Licensed providers must not use any name other than that specified in the licence.
heading: to, the Drug Trafficking (Recovery of Proceeds) Ordinance (Cap. 405);

compliance_objective: Ensure the Commission is informed of contact details.
explanation: A licensed representative must keep the Commission informed of their contact details, including residential address, telephone number, and electronic mail address.
heading: RS applies in relation to the making of a decision under this section if the decision

compliance_objective: Notify the Commission of changes in contact details.
explanation: A licensed representative must inform the Commission of any changes to their particulars within 7 business days after the change occurs.
heading: RS applies in relation to the making of a decision under this section if the decision

compliance_objective: Prevent the use of unlicensed names when providing VA services.
explanation: A licensed representative must not use any name other than the name under which they are licensed when providing a VA service.
heading: RS applies in relation to the making of a decision under this section if the decision

provision: Part 2 Customer Due Diligence Requirements Division 1 —General 2
compliance_objective: Ensure identification and verification of customers and beneficial owners.
explanation: Financial institutions and DNFBPs must identify and verify the identity of customers based on reliable sources, including governmental bodies and recognized digital identification systems.

provision: Part 2 Customer Due Diligence Requirements Division 1 —General 2(a)(b)
compliance_objective: Identify and verify beneficial owners.
explanation: If there is a beneficial owner, institutions must identify and verify their identity to ensure understanding of ownership and control structures.

provision: Part 2 Customer Due Diligence Requirements Division 1 —General 2(c)
compliance_objective: Obtain information on the purpose and intended nature of business relationships.
explanation: Institutions must gather information regarding the purpose and intended nature of the business relationship unless it is obvious.

provision: Part 2 Customer Due Diligence Requirements Division 1 —General 2(d)
compliance_objective: Identify and verify individuals acting on behalf of customers.
explanation: Institutions must identify and verify the identity of individuals acting on behalf of customers and verify their authority to act.

compliance_objective: Carry out customer due diligence before establishing a business relationship.
explanation: A financial institution or a DNFBP must conduct customer due diligence measures prior to establishing a business relationship with the customer.

compliance_objective: Conduct customer due diligence for transactions above specified thresholds.
explanation: Customer due diligence measures must be carried out before executing an occasional transaction involving an amount equal to or above $120,000 or its equivalent.

compliance_objective: Perform customer due diligence for wire transfers above specified thresholds.
explanation: A financial institution must conduct customer due diligence before processing a wire transfer of $8,000 or more.

compliance_objective: Conduct customer due diligence for virtual asset transfers above specified thresholds.
explanation: Customer due diligence measures must be carried out before executing a virtual asset transfer involving amounts of $8,000 or more.

compliance_objective: Perform customer due diligence for licensed VAS provider transactions above specified thresholds.
explanation: A licensed VAS provider must carry out customer due diligence before conducting any occasional transaction involving an amount equal to or above $8,000.

compliance_objective: Do not establish business relationships without compliance.
explanation: If a financial institution or DNFBP cannot comply with customer due diligence requirements, they must not establish a business relationship with that customer.

compliance_objective: Terminate business relationships if compliance is not met.
explanation: If a financial institution or DNFBP has already established a business relationship but cannot comply with due diligence, they must terminate that relationship as soon as practicable.

compliance_objective: To ensure customer due diligence measures are appropriately applied.
explanation: A financial institution or DNFBP must carry out customer due diligence measures unless they have reasonable grounds to believe that the product related to the transaction falls within specific categories.

compliance_objective: To define the minimum customer due diligence measures that must be conducted.
explanation: If the financial institution or DNFBP has reasonable grounds, they may limit customer due diligence to specific measures outlined in this section.

compliance_objective: To identify products that allow for reduced customer due diligence.
explanation: The section specifies certain products, such as pension schemes and specific insurance policies, that qualify for reduced due diligence measures.

compliance_objective: To clarify exceptions for solicitors regarding customer due diligence.
explanation: Financial institutions are not required to carry out certain due diligence measures for accounts held by solicitors under specific conditions.

compliance_objective: Ensure customer documents are up-to-date and relevant.
explanation: Financial institutions or DNFBPs must continuously monitor customer relationships by reviewing documents and information to ensure they are current.
heading: to the Securities and

compliance_objective: Scrutinize transactions for consistency with customer profiles.
explanation: Institutions must conduct appropriate scrutiny of transactions to ensure they align with the institution's knowledge of the customer and their risk profile.
heading: to the Securities and

compliance_objective: Identify and examine unusual transactions.
explanation: Institutions must identify transactions that are complex, unusually large, or lack apparent economic purpose, and document the findings.
heading: to the Securities and

compliance_objective: Conduct due diligence on unusual or suspicious transactions.
explanation: For pre-existing customers, institutions must perform customer due diligence when unusual or suspicious transactions occur.
heading: to the Securities and

compliance_objective: Terminate business relationships if due diligence cannot be performed.
explanation: If institutions cannot comply with due diligence requirements, they must terminate the business relationship promptly.
heading: to the Securities and

compliance_objective: Verify identity of customers not physically present.
explanation: Institutions must take additional measures to verify the identity of customers who are not physically present for identification purposes.
heading: to the Securities and

compliance_objective: Ensure proper identification of customers not physically present.
explanation: Financial institutions or DNFBPs must verify the identity of customers who are not physically present by using additional documents or information not previously used.
heading: to the Securities and

compliance_objective: Ensure payments are made through compliant accounts.
explanation: Payments related to the customer's account must be conducted through an account in the customer's name with an authorized institution or equivalent.
heading: to the Securities and

compliance_objective: Avoid non-compliance with identification requirements.
explanation: The identification measures do not apply if the customer has been verified using a recognized digital identification system.
heading: to the Securities and

compliance_objective: Obtain senior management approval for politically exposed persons.
explanation: Financial institutions or DNFBPs must obtain approval from senior management before establishing a business relationship with a politically exposed person.
heading: to the Securities and

compliance_objective: Establish source of wealth and funds for politically exposed persons.
explanation: Financial institutions or DNFBPs must take reasonable measures to establish the source of wealth and funds of politically exposed persons before establishing a business relationship.
heading: to the Securities and

compliance_objective: Record beneficiary information for insurance policies.
explanation: Financial institutions must record the name of a beneficiary identified by name or obtain sufficient information to establish the identity of a beneficiary designated by description.
heading: to the Securities and

compliance_objective: Verify beneficiary identity at payout.
explanation: Financial institutions must verify the beneficiary's identity using reliable sources at the time of payout or when the beneficiary exercises a right under the insurance policy.
heading: to the Securities and

compliance_objective: Identify beneficial owners of legal persons or trusts.
explanation: Financial institutions must identify the beneficial owners of a legal person or trust and verify their identities if there is a high risk of money laundering or terrorist financing.
heading: to the Securities and

compliance_objective: Record essential information before wire transfer.
explanation: A financial institution must record the originator's name, account number or unique reference number, address, customer identification number, and recipient's name and account number or unique reference number before carrying out a wire transfer.
erc_3643: function recordWireTransferDetails(originatorName, originatorAccount, originatorAddress, originatorID, recipientName, recipientAccount)
heading: to the Securities and

compliance_objective: Include recorded information in the payment form for wire transfers.
explanation: For wire transfers equal to or above $8,000, the financial institution must include the recorded information in the accompanying message or payment form.
heading: to the Securities and

compliance_objective: Provide additional information upon request for domestic wire transfers.
explanation: If a financial institution includes only limited information in the message for a domestic wire transfer, it must provide the full information upon request within 3 business days.
heading: to the Securities and

compliance_objective: Obtain missing information for domestic wire transfers.
explanation: A beneficiary institution must obtain missing information if the wire transfer is not accompanied by required information and take measures to mitigate risks if it cannot be obtained.
heading: to the Securities and

compliance_objective: Obtain missing information for non-domestic wire transfers.
explanation: For non-domestic wire transfers lacking required information, the beneficiary or intermediary institution must obtain the missing information and mitigate risks if it cannot be obtained.
heading: to the Securities and

compliance_objective: Identify and verify the originator for remittance transactions.
explanation: A licensed money service operator must identify and verify the originator's identity before carrying out a remittance transaction involving amounts equal to or above $8,000.
heading: to the Securities and

compliance_objective: Record essential details for remittance transactions.
explanation: The licensed money service operator must record the originator's name, identification document number, address, currency and amount, date and time of receipt, recipient's name and address, and method of delivery.
heading: to the Securities and

compliance_objective: Obtain and record originator and recipient information for virtual asset transfers.
explanation: Before carrying out a virtual asset transfer, a financial institution must obtain and record specific information about the originator and recipient, including names, addresses, and account details.
heading: to the Securities and

compliance_objective: Submit required information to beneficiary institutions for virtual asset transfers.
explanation: A financial institution must submit the recorded information to the beneficiary institution, depending on the amount of the virtual asset transfer.
heading: to the Securities and

compliance_objective: Record information received from the ordering institution.
explanation: A beneficiary institution must obtain and record the information submitted by the ordering institution regarding the virtual asset transfer.
heading: to the Securities and

compliance_objective: Transmit all received information in virtual asset transfers.
explanation: An intermediary institution must transmit all information it receives with the transfer to the institution to which it passes on the transfer instruction.
heading: to the Securities and

compliance_objective: Obtain missing information if not all required information is submitted.
explanation: If the instructed institution does not receive all required information, it must obtain the missing information from the instructing institution as soon as practicable.
heading: to the Securities and

compliance_objective: Mitigate risks if information is incomplete or meaningless.
explanation: If the instructed institution is aware that the information it received is incomplete or meaningless, it must take reasonable measures to mitigate the risk of money laundering or terrorist financing.
heading: to the Securities and

compliance_objective: Collect sufficient information about proposed respondent banks before establishing correspondent banking relationships.
explanation: An authorized institution must collect sufficient information to understand the nature of the proposed respondent bank's business before establishing a correspondent banking relationship.
heading: to the Securities and

compliance_objective: Ensure adequate anti-money laundering controls before establishing correspondent banking relationships.
explanation: An authorized institution must not establish a correspondent banking relationship unless it is satisfied that the proposed respondent bank's anti-money laundering controls are adequate and effective.
heading: to the Securities and

compliance_objective: Obtain senior management approval to establish a business relationship.
explanation: A financial institution or DNFBP must obtain approval from senior management before establishing a business relationship in high-risk situations.
heading: to the Securities and

compliance_objective: Establish the source of wealth and funds for customers.
explanation: In high-risk situations, the institution must take reasonable measures to establish the relevant customer’s or beneficial owner’s source of wealth and the source of funds involved in the business relationship.
heading: to the Securities and

compliance_objective: Mitigate risks of money laundering or terrorist financing.
explanation: The institution must take additional measures to mitigate the risk of money laundering or terrorist financing in high-risk situations.
heading: to the Securities and

compliance_objective: Obtain senior management approval to continue a business relationship.
explanation: For established business relationships, the institution must obtain approval from senior management to continue the relationship in high-risk situations.
heading: to the Securities and

compliance_objective: Verify the identity of beneficial owners.
explanation: The institution must take reasonable measures to verify the identity of the beneficial owner to ensure they know who the beneficial owner is.
heading: to the Securities and

compliance_objective: Establish the source of wealth and funds for beneficial owners.
explanation: The institution must take reasonable measures to establish the relevant customer’s or beneficial owner’s source of wealth and the source of funds involved in the business relationship.
heading: to the Securities and

compliance_objective: Mitigate risks of money laundering or terrorist financing.
explanation: The institution must take additional measures to mitigate the risk of money laundering or terrorist financing for established business relationships.
heading: to the Securities and

compliance_objective: Mitigate risks for occasional transactions.
explanation: For occasional transactions, the institution must take additional measures to mitigate the risk of money laundering or terrorist financing.
heading: to the Securities and

compliance_objective: Prohibit anonymous accounts.
explanation: A financial institution or DNFBP must not open or maintain any anonymous account or account in a fictitious name for any customer.
heading: to the Securities and

compliance_objective: Prohibit correspondent banking relationships with shell banks.
explanation: An authorized institution must not establish or continue a correspondent banking relationship with a corporation that does not have a physical presence and is not an affiliate of a corporation with a physical presence.
heading: to the Securities and

compliance_objective: Obtain written consent from intermediaries for customer due diligence.
explanation: A financial institution or DNFBP may carry out customer due diligence measures through an intermediary only if the intermediary consents in writing.
heading: to the Securities and

compliance_objective: Ensure intermediaries provide documentation on request.
explanation: The financial institution or DNFBP must be satisfied that the intermediary will provide documentation or records obtained during customer due diligence without delay.
heading: to the Securities and

compliance_objective: Maintain liability for customer due diligence measures.
explanation: The financial institution or DNFBP remains liable for any failure to carry out customer due diligence measures, even when using an intermediary.
heading: to the Securities and

compliance_objective: Establish procedures to identify politically exposed persons.
explanation: A financial institution or DNFBP must establish and maintain effective procedures for determining whether a customer or a beneficial owner is a politically exposed person.
heading: to the Securities and

compliance_objective: Establish procedures for handling wire transfers.
explanation: A financial institution that carries out wire transfers must establish and maintain effective procedures for identifying and handling wire transfers that do not comply with section 12(5).
heading: to the Securities and

compliance_objective: Establish procedures for handling virtual asset transfers.
explanation: A financial institution that carries out virtual asset transfers must establish and maintain effective procedures for identifying and handling virtual asset transfers that do not comply with section 13A(4).
heading: to the Securities and

compliance_objective: Establish procedures for customer due diligence.
explanation: A financial institution or DNFBP must establish and maintain effective procedures for each kind of customer, business relationship, product, and transaction to carry out duties under specified sections.
heading: to the Securities and

compliance_objective: Keep records of transactions.
explanation: A financial institution or DNFBP must keep the original or a copy of documents and a record of data and information obtained in connection with each transaction.
heading: to the Securities and

compliance_objective: Keep records related to customer identification.
explanation: A financial institution or DNFBP must keep the original or a copy of documents and records obtained in the course of identifying and verifying the identity of the customer or beneficial owner.
heading: to the Securities and

compliance_objective: Maintain records for a minimum period.
explanation: Records required to be kept must be maintained for at least 5 years from the date the transaction is completed.
heading: to the Securities and

compliance_objective: Maintain records of customer transactions.
explanation: Records of transactions must be kept for at least 5 years from the completion date.
heading: to the Securities and

compliance_objective: Maintain records of customer accounts and correspondence.
explanation: Records relating to the customer's account and correspondence must be kept for at least 5 years after the business relationship ends.
heading: to the Securities and

compliance_objective: Maintain records of occasional transactions.
explanation: Records for occasional transactions must be kept for at least 5 years from the completion date.
heading: to the Securities and

compliance_objective: Comply with extended record-keeping requirements from authorities.
explanation: Records must be kept for a longer period if required by a relevant authority or regulatory body.
heading: to the Securities and

compliance_objective: Adhere to notices from authorities regarding record retention.
explanation: Financial institutions or DNFBPs must keep records for the period specified in a notice from a relevant authority.
heading: to the Securities and

compliance_objective: Implement safeguards to prevent contraventions.
explanation: Financial institutions and DNFBPs must take reasonable measures to prevent contraventions of requirements under Parts 2 and 3.
heading: to the Securities and

compliance_objective: Mitigate risks of money laundering and terrorist financing.
explanation: Financial institutions and DNFBPs must take reasonable measures to mitigate risks associated with money laundering and terrorist financing.
heading: to the Securities and

compliance_objective: Ensure that a VA exchange operates in compliance with the requirements for binding transactions.
explanation: The provision mandates that a VA exchange must regularly make or accept offers to sell or purchase virtual assets that result in binding transactions, ensuring compliance with anti-money laundering regulations.
erc_3643: function offerTransaction(address seller, address buyer, uint256 amount, string memory assetType) external returns (bool);
heading: B

compliance_objective: Facilitate the identification of parties involved in virtual asset transactions.
explanation: The provision requires that persons are regularly introduced or identified to facilitate negotiations or conclude sales or purchases of virtual assets, ensuring traceability and compliance.
erc_3643: function identifyParties(address partyA, address partyB) external returns (bool);
heading: B

compliance_objective: Safeguard client funds and virtual assets.
explanation: The provision states that client money or client virtual assets must come into the direct or indirect possession of the service provider, necessitating secure handling and storage mechanisms.
erc_3643: function handleClientAssets(address client, uint256 amount, string memory assetType) external returns (bool);
heading: B
